= getfollower =

== Syntax ==
 unitptr := getfollower( master_unit : unitptr, index : integer );

== Parameters ==
 master_unit : unitptr
    The character whose follower list should be searched. Must be a character unit (PC or NPC).
 index : integer
    The zero-based index of the follower to retrieve. Must be >= 0.

== Return Value ==
 unitptr
    Returns the follower unit at the specified index if found.
    Returns null if the index is out of range or no follower exists at that position.
    Returns fail if the master_unit is null, not a character, or if parameters are invalid.

== Description ==
 The getfollower() function retrieves a specific follower from a character's follower list by index. This is commonly used in group management systems to iterate through all followers of a group leader.

 The function works with the internal follower chain where each character can have multiple followers arranged in a linked list. The index parameter allows direct access to followers without needing to traverse the entire chain.

== Example ==
 dilbegin list_followers(leader_name : string);
 var
    leader : unitptr;
    follower : unitptr;
    count : integer;
    buffer : string;
 code
 {
    leader := findunit(self, leader_name, FIND_UNIT_SURRO, null);
    
    if (leader == null) {
       sendtext("Leader not found.&n", self);
       quit;
    }
    
    buffer := "Followers of " + leader.name + ":&n";
    count := 0;
    
    while (count < leader.followercount) {
       follower := getfollower(leader, count);
       
       if (follower) {
          buffer := buffer + "  " + itoa(count) + ": " + follower.name + "&n";
       }
       
       count := count + 1;
    }
    
    sendtext(buffer, self);
    quit;
 } dilend
